quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: National Motto and Motto
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, mean, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the national motto of San Marino?
What type of meal is the traditional Peruvian dish called Ceviche?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seafood meal

questions.question: What river in Peru is considered to be the main headwater of the Amazon River?
What is the name of the capital and largest city of Iraq?
The national motto of Wales is Cymru am byth. What does this mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wales forever

questions.question: The national motto of what European country is The strength of the nation lies in unity?
What religion has the largest number of followers in Peru according to the 2007 census?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roman Catholicism

questions.question: Un peuple, un but, une foi, or One people, one goal, one faith, is the national motto of this African country.
What type of government does the Republic of Peru have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Presidential republic

questions.question: Mir welle bleiwe wat mir sinn is the national motto of Luxembourg. What does this mean in English?

options.text: Our country means the world to us.
We wish to remain what we are.
Independence is what makes us who we are.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: We wish to remain what we are.

questions.question: Тhe slogan The love of liberty brought us here is the national motto of what African country?
Which of these is the national motto of Cuba?

options.text: After the Good Lord, we love the Earth

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Homeland or Death

questions.question: The national motto of the Republic of Kenya is Harambee. What is the meaning of this Swahili expression in English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Let us all pull together.

questions.question: The Latin phrase Quo Fata Ferunt, or Whither the Fates Carry Us, is the national motto of this country.
The national motto of what South American country is One people, one nation, one destiny?

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Iraq and Singapore
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, iraq, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What type of meat is used for the preparation of the meal called Shawarma, which is very popular in the Middle East, including Iraq?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Who is considered the founder of modern Singapore?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Raffles

questions.question: Iraq is known for the musical instruments oud and rebab. What type of instruments are they?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stringed instruments

questions.question: What type of governmental control has Iraq established?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Parliamentary republic

questions.question: The official motto of Iraq is Allahu Akbar, and it is emblazoned on the national flag of the country. What does the motto mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: God is the greatest

questions.question: What language was adopted as official by the government of Iraq?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kurdish and Arabic

questions.question: By 1900, Singapore had a population of nearly how many residents?
What are the basic colors of the national flag of Iraq?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red, white and black

questions.question: What animal is depicted on the national coat of arms of Iraq?
What does the name of Iraq mean in Arabic?
How long did the fight for Singapore last during WWII?
In 1926, Singapore, Penang, and this settlement were combined to form the Straits Settlements.
What was Singapore renamed to during the Japanese occupation (1942-1945)?

options.text: Singapore was not renamed by the Japanese.

questions.question: This civilization, which is believed to be the oldest on the planet, flourished in the lands of modern Iraq.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sumerian civilization

questions.question: When did Singapore become a British crown colony?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Taiwan and Singapore
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, title, june. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the title of the national anthem of Taiwan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: Taiwan is the largest island of what country
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Republic of China

questions.question: What is the name of the capital and largest city of Taiwan?
In 1963, Singapore became part of Malaysia.
What is the color of the national flag of Taiwan?
What religion has the largest number of followers among the population of Taiwan?
Grass jelly is a popular desert in Taiwan and other countries in Southeast Asia. What is it made from?
The name Morocco originated from the Berber expression Mur-Akush,. What does it mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Land of God

questions.question: Singapore created a constitution on June 3, 1959 after achieving full internal self-government.
What design is depicted on the national emblem of Taiwan?
Who was Singapores first prime minister?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lee Kwan Yew

questions.question: What is the name of the island on which the country known as Taiwan is situated?
How long did Lee Kwan Yew serve as prime minister of Singapore?
Which of these bird species is endemic to Taiwan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the official language recognized by the government of Taiwan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mandarin Chinese

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Ibiza and Morocco
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, title, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the title of the national anthem of Morocco?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hymn of the Sharif

questions.question: Ibiza is most well-known for which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Night life

questions.question: In which water basin is the island of Ibiza located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mediterranean Sea

questions.question: The monument called The Egg, located in Saint Antonio, Ibiza, was erected in honor of which great explorer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christopher Columbus

questions.question: The capital of the island country Ibiza is its largest city - Eiviss Cuidad (Ibiza City).
The island of Ibiza is unique in having which of the following?

options.text: The greatest population density among all islands in the world
The largest club in the world
The only underwater club in the world
The busiest highway in the world

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The largest club in the world

questions.question: What design is depicted on the national flag of Morocco?
Which of the following music formations had a resident of Ibiza among its members?
What is the most popular traditional drink in Morocco?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green tea with mint

questions.question: Which of the following is named after the island of Ibiza?

options.text: A dish prepared with tuna fish and blue cheese

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A music genre

questions.question: Which of the following novels does not use the island of Ibiza as setting to its action?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They all do

questions.question: What type of governmental control has Morocco established?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Constitutional monarchy

questions.question: Name the only two African countries that share borders with Morocco.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Algeria and Mauritania

questions.question: What is the official language spoken in Morocco?
Ibiza belongs to the Balearic Islands, an autonomous community of which European country?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Statue and Type
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, taliban, daibutsu. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This statue, which was enshrined in 2005, is 108-metre (354 ft) tall.

options.text: Yellow Chinese emperors Huangdi and Yandi, China
Statue of Peter I, Moscow, Russia
Buddhist statue of Guanyin, Sanya, China

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buddhist statue of Guanyin, Sanya, China

questions.question: Christ the Redeemer is a statue located at the peak of the Corcovado mountain.
The Motherland Calls is a statue designed to commemorate the Soviet victory in the Eastern Front of World War II.
The Ushiku Daibutsu, which depicts Amitabha Buddha, is located in this country.
What type of dessert is the Pandoro, very popular in Italy around Christmas and New Year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sweet bread

questions.question: What type of food is the Pavlova, very popular in Australia and New Zealand?
At the time of its construction this statue of Buddha was the tallest statue in the world.

options.text: Buddhist statue of Guanyin, Sanya, China
Statue of Lanshan Buddha, Lanshan, China

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Statue of Lanshan Buddha, Lanshan, China

questions.question: Which monumental statues were destroyed by the Taliban in 2001 because they were considered “idols”.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Buddhas of Bamyan, Afghanistan

questions.question: What type of fish is traditionally consumed smoked at Christmas in France?
The Cougnou Christmas bread is traditionally shaped like what?
Which colossal statue was given to the United States by France in 1886?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Statue of Liberty

questions.question: What statue was designed by Georgian designer Zurab Tsereteli to commemorate 300 years of the Russian Navy?

options.text: Peter the Great Statue in Moscow

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter the Great Statue in Moscow

questions.question: Ibizas name dates back to 654 BC when Phoenician settlers founded a port called Ibossim.  What is the meaning of this name?

options.text: It is a dedication to a god of the fire
It is a dedication to a god of music and dance

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is a dedication to a god of music and dance

questions.question: A statue of two ancient emperors, named Huangdi and Yandi, is located in China.
Which of these is a memorial of the Great Patriotic War (1941-1945)?

options.text: Statue of Peter I, Moscow, Russia
Statue of Liberty, Liberty Island, New York

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Motherland, Kiev, Ukraine

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: State and Virginia
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, cake, dessert. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The dish Pigs in a blanket, traditionally prepared for Christmas in the United Kingdom, is also known by what name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the prevailing Christian denomination in the US state of Virginia?
What meat is traditionally consumed at Christmas in Mexico?
What nickname has been given to the US state of Virginia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mother of Presidents

questions.question: The official Latin motto of the US state of Virginia is Sic semper tyrannis. What does this mean in English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thus always to tyrants

questions.question: What sea food is traditionally present on the Christmas table in Spain?
What is the color of the official state flag of the US state of Virginia, officially known as the Commonwealth of Virginia?
What is the state flower and one of the symbols of the US state of Virginia?
What is the state bird and symbol of the US state of Virginia?
In what month are the Virginia State Fair and the Neptune Festival held annually in the U.S. state of Virginia?
What is the name of the capital city of the US state of Virginia?
Which of these famous American actresses was born in the U.S. state of Virginia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sandra Bullock

questions.question: The Christmas fruit cake stollen comes from what country?
The dessert called bibingka is traditionally prepared during Christmas in what country?
What drink is very popular during Christmas in the United States?
